etymology.description: 等(等) (děng, "wait; rank; class") + 等(等) (děng, "wait; rank; class") is a repetition used to indicate continuation, often translated as "etc." or "and so on." This suggests incompleteness, indicating that what has been mentioned is part of a larger list or sequence.
etymology.interpretation: The repetition of 等(等) (děng, "wait; rank; class") emphasizes continuity or an extension of a list, commonly abbreviated in English as "etc." to indicate additional items are included.

examples.chinese: 书店里有小说(書店裡有小說)，杂志(雜誌)，等等(等等)。
examples.pinyin: Shūdiàn lǐ yǒu xiǎoshuō, zázhì, děngděng.
examples.english: The bookstore has novels, magazines, and so on.

examples.chinese: 他们讨论了旅行计划(他們討論了旅行計劃)，价格(價格)，等等(等等)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen tǎolùn le lǚxíng jìhuà, jiàgé, děngděng.
examples.english: They discussed travel plans, prices, etc.

examples.chinese: 餐桌上摆满了菜(餐桌上擺滿了菜)，水果(水果)，等等(等等)。
examples.pinyin: Cānzhuō shàng bǎi mǎn le cài, shuǐguǒ, děngděng.
examples.english: The table is filled with dishes, fruits, and so on.
